extracted_information: Browser-use is a framework designed to enable AI agents to control web browsers and automate online tasks. It aims to make websites accessible for AI agents and simplify web automation. The framework supports integration with various Large Language Models (LLMs) and external tools via the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

citation_information.author: Müller, Magnus and Žunič, Gregor
citation_information.title: Browser Use: Enable AI to control your browser

details: Enables AI agents to control and interact with web browsers.
Agents can perform complex tasks based on natural language prompts.
Supports various LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, DeepSeek) for decision-making and task execution.
Agents can connect to multiple external MCP servers to extend capabilities (e.g., filesystem access, GitHub operations).
Roadmap includes improving agent memory for +100 steps and enhancing planning capabilities by loading website-specific context.
Automate online tasks with ease, including web scraping, form filling, and general browser interactions.

Examples of automated tasks: adding grocery items to cart and checking out, adding LinkedIn followers to Salesforce leads, finding and applying to jobs, generating documents in Google Docs and saving as PDF, extracting specific data from websites (e.g., Hugging Face models based on license and likes).
Supports recording user workflows for re-execution, even if page elements change.
Enables parallelization of similar tasks (e.g., finding contact information for multiple companies simultaneously).
Offers a mechanism for robust agent testing and validation in a Continuous Integration (CI) environment.
Users can add specific tasks (YAML files in `tests/agent_tasks/`) with defined evaluation criteria.
Tasks are automatically run and evaluated by the agent upon every project update, ensuring functionality and robustness.
Hosted cloud version available for instant browser automation without local setup.
Documentation available for installation and advanced settings.
Tools like Web UI and Desktop App for testing and interaction.
Interactive CLI for direct agent interaction.
Roadmap includes creating templates for various use cases (tutorials, job applications, QA testing, social media), improving documentation, and enhancing performance.
